metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6811 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
The 'Copy as cURL' feature of Devtools' network tab did not properly escapethe HTTP method of a request, which can be controlled by the website. If auser used the 'Copy as Curl' feature and pasted the command into aterminal, it could have resulted in command injection and arbitrary commandexecution. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.6, Firefox < 74,Firefox < ESR68.6, and Firefox ESR < 68.6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6811` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 74.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '74.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.6.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
